casebody.data:
[*] NEAFIE vs. ACKERMAN’S Executors. The action below, was brought to recover a demand for ten hundred weight of rye meal, on a charge that it was sold to Neafie, by the testator, Ackerman, in April, 1796. ISTq demand of payment, or promise to pay, was either proved or alledged. The defendant set up the statute of limitations in bar of the demand; this the justice over-ruled, and ren-; dered judgment against Neafie. This being assigned for error, the Court Reversed the judgment.

ON CERTIORARI,
